course_title: Special Topics in African American Studies: Global Literature in English
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 18 / Seats Avail: 1Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as ENG 214W 1)
(This course provides a broad overview of contemporary Anglophone Caribbean literatures and their diasporas. We will examine novels, primarily, as well as poetry and prose from a range of Caribbean nation-states to consider their confluences, or shared concerns, as well as their regional and cultural distinctions. Topics covered will include, but are not limited to, slavery, colonialism, history, memory, race, hybridity, gender, sexuality, and class. Authors may include Dionne Brand, Michelle Cliff, Kamau Brathwaite, Earl Lovelace, Jamaica Kincaid, Erna Brodber among others.)
course_description: Wide range of topics pertinent to the African American experience.
sections: Class Nbr: 1948, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: M. Yates-Richard, Status: Open
